greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: E.g.f.: A(x) = 1/(1 - LambertW(-x)^2).
comment: E.g.f. equals the square of the e.g.f. of A060435, where A060435(n) = number of functions f: {1,2,...,n} -> {1,2,...,n} with even cycles only.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
formula: a(n) = n! * [x^n] exp(n*x)/(1 + x). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Sep 18 2018
example: The formula A(x) = 1/(1 - LambertW(-x)^2) is illustrated by:
mathematica: a[x0_] := x D[1/x Exp[x], {x, n}] x^n Exp[-x] /. x->x0
xref: Cf. A060435; indirectly related: A062817, A132608.
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Oct 11 2007
